intro: Habranthus arenicola, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, which bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is often cultivated in xeriscapes and coastal gardens.
